description:
Thank You for making this software!

The search results are too far to the left in their frame when the window is regular sized and maximized. There's no way to scroll to the left. It didn't use to do that, but now it's a problem.
I really love this app, its a good substitute for Logos on Windows 10
Cypher key required - what rubbish - about as polished as a 100 year garbage can. Cannot be used

I have used Xiphos as my 'go-to' Bible study program for over 6 years, it has improved during this time greatly. Thank you to those maitaining and developing this great study tool.
One wish, that I could choose to increase the time for the mouse hover over a link to react and throw up text in the magnifier! 500ms would be just fine, and gain the fifth star rating! 
Learn to use this tool, it will repay your effort many times over.
John F
Just about anything you could want in the public domain and some stuff which licensing allows that isn't. Great app not just for Biblical texts, but also for commentaries, etc.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description: Wonderful app.
summary: Quick, Versatile, FREE, Comprehensive, Customizable, Highly Reccomend

description: It is not very intuitive.
it is simple and comfortable.
I have used this for a few years now and am pleased with the simplicity and the fact that I have never come across any problems with the app itself. Very dependable. Well done.
says i need cipher key from netnotes?

Provides a surprisingly full assortment of available texts. Bibles, as well as other materials from Wesley, Calvin, Bunyan, and others. Also, there are a large assortment of commentaries, confessions, and catechisms. No NIV or other such newer materials to be found from what I can tell, probably due to copyright restrictions, but if you can get along with the KJV/Geneva or things like that, you'll do fine. There are also modernized versions of these, though I can speak to their reliability, but if you're timid of dealing with some of the more archain language of the older translations, that may be a good option for you.
summary: Does What It Says On The Tin

description:
There should be at least a trial version of this or any app for that matter. If you are looking for reviews anyway otherwise dont even bother asking for reviews. I normally would install any package on a VM and do a full test and feature review but in this case or in many other apps they wan to you to pay before you can review the app.
The documentation points to a simple way to ask to Unlock the modules but in the app ther is no such feature. Again, the Bible does not belong to anyone like to be using its content to make money. At the end if you have a talent you should use it to bring people to the knowledge of God. If the talent was givent to you why should you charge for using it? Or something to that effect...

i use the Nontakeinvain.com website to simply read the New Testament in understandable English for non native speakers.
It is a side by side comparison version, compiled from these ones:
*kjv = king james version
*erv = easy-to-read version \ english version for the deaf
*litv = green's literal translation

I have used other like e-sword on Linux. Yet getting e-sword to work with wine and playonlinux is a pain to say the least. This app worked much better with the same and even better features, solid experience. Yes a little hard to get going at first with all the installations of Bibles, I would ship some defaults like KJV if I was you. But hey, great work guys! Thanks for an excellent app!
I love it!!

I have been used to E-Sword and that was easy to load and you have so much to choose from right out of the box. Was hoping this would be at least as good. If it is - Please help new loaders to find it - Please!
Very easy to use Nice work for a great cause.
It's easy to install and setup. Very easy to manage modules
summary: Best bible software available for linux

description: I have used this program for years, especially dealing with the original languages. However, in Hebrew, the Aleppo text is not the same as downloaded from the website, and the program has trouble separating the Ketiv-Qere entries in the other Hebrew texts. There has been no improvement even though the problems have persisted for years. Greek and other languages I have used have presented me with no problems.
summary: Still has a few glitches, otherwise great

description: Needs to be user friendly
Totally useless unfriendly xiphos xchristian

Using the material from the Sword project, Xiphos produces a package for Bible study which is mainly intuitive and very useable. The variety of resources available is both impressive (as the available library is extensive) and restricted (as almost everything is old enough to be out of copyright meaning it is free but outdated :( ). Users rely on the goodwill and patience of the Sword project scholars to make modules available which means infrequent additions and updates to the library. As a free resource it is second to none and its search facility is actually better than the market-leading proprietary package. For any preacher or Bible scholar this is more than useful to have in your back pocket and I thoroughly recommend it; the fifth star is only missing due to the limited up-to-date resources.
summary: A useful go-to Bible study package

description: Has been a great Bible app for Linux for many years and the addition of the NET and NASB and downloadable translations makes it even better.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description: This looks great for some, but to make it better, the UI needs to be setup for new-to-Linux people. I have tutored many in Computer Science who are new to Linux and find that the more popular applications tend to be more user friendly for new users as well as more experienced.
Needs some polish and thought on the intuitiveness concerning how certain actions are initiated. But otherwhise I find it to be on par with the mobile bible app available at mybible.zone . Thanks.

This App is so incredible. I cannot believe how fast it works and all the various translations can be downloaded with ease. 

I am looking for the Jerusalem Bible which is missing so I want to give 4.5 stars, but its not an option please add this version
summary: Incredible resource, please add the Jerusalem Bible

description: I use two of Bible Software applications CrossWire Bible Society produces, I prefer Xiphos for it's flexibility and the ability to customise Xiphos completely to one's needs. There's a great wealth of resources available picking up centuries of excellent Christian writings as well as some really recent Biblical texts. Thank you for all the hard work you have put into all CrossWire Bible Society software and for making it available free of charge.
summary: Simply the best free Bible Software

description: После установки приложения, нужно будет ещё выбрать: какие модули загрузить, на каком языке и с какого сервера. Всё это есть в самом приложении. С первого раза установить модули не получилось. Навигация по главам и стихам стрелками в панели управления. Поиск по ключевым словам удобный. Интерфейс можно настроить под свои нужды. Одним словом — понравилось.
